A_Questions:
Finish the sentence:
I have to ________.
C_Questions:
Finish the sentence:
I know how to _________.
D_Questions: Which is smaller? An elephant or a mouse?
D_Answers: A mouse is smaller than an elephant.
E_Questions: Do you know how to cook ramen?
E_Answers: Yes, I do. / No, I don't.

C_Questions:
Fix (直して):
I can tell you where go.
C_Answers: I can tell you where <u>to</u> go.
D_Questions:
Fix (直して):
Pizza is the deliciousest food of all.
E_Questions: What must you do at home?

A_Questions:
Unmix (並べ替えて):
bring / don't / we / our / have to / tablets
A_Answers: We don't have to bring our tablets.
B_Questions:
Unmix (並べ替えて):
taking / I / nature / like / of / pictures
B_Answers: I like taking pictures of nature.
C_Questions: He + tell you + when + wake up = ???
C_Answers: He can tell you when to wake up.
D_Questions:
Unmix (並べ替えて):
as / Curtis / the Super Famicom / old / is / as
D_Answers: Curtis is as old as the Super Famicom.
E_Questions: What food do you like the best?

A_Questions:
Fix (直して):
She not have to speak perfect English.
A_Answers: She <u>does</u> not have to speak perfect English.
B_Questions: <u>彼とゲームをすること</u> was fun.
B_Answers: Playing games with him was fun.
C_Questions:
Unmix (並べ替えて):
sure / I / English / fun / that / am / is
C_Answers: I am sure that English is fun.
E_Questions: What is the smallest prefecture in Japan?
E_Answers: Kagawa is the smallest prefecture in Japan.

A_Questions: Cinderella must <u>(12時までに帰宅しなければなりません)</u>
B_Questions:
Fix (直して):
Last night he finish read that book.
B_Answers: Last night he <u>finished reading</u> that book.
C_Questions: Curtis knows <u>(どこで美味しいピザを食べられるか)</u>
C_Answers: Curtis knows where to eat delicious pizza.
D_Questions:
Unmix (並べ替えて):
like / ten / the best / students / sports / soccer / of all
D_Answers: Ten students like soccer the best of all sports.
E_Questions: Which is taller, the Eiffel Tower or Tokyo Tower?
E_Answers: Tokyo Tower (333m) is taller than the Eiffel Tower (330m).

A_Questions:
Say in English:
私は英語を勉強し続けなければなりません。
B_Questions:
Say in English:
夕食を食べ終わってから、テレビを見ることを楽しみます。
B_Answers: After I finish eating dinner, I enjoy playing games.
C_Questions:
Say in English:
あなたはパンを作り方を知らなくてもよいです。
C_Answers: You don't have to know how to bake/make bread.
D_Questions:
Say in English:
私はバスケするよりも本を読むのが好きです。
D_Answers: I like reading books more than playing basketball.
E_Questions: Which is older, Nagoya Castle or America?
E_Answers: Nagoya Castle (1532) is older than America (1776).
F_Questions:
何があっても、とにかく
…にかかわらず
